result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather Ann Spaeth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, and complete any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall comply with and successfully complete the Washington County Drug Treatment Court.

timeConds.notes:
NO HUBER.

STAYED for use by the Drug Treatment Court Judge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather Ann Spaeth

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Heather Ann Spaeth appeared by phone.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Heather Ann Spaeth. Def consents to phone appearance for sentencing.  Agreement reached.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1.  Statements from State and counsel. Court proceeds to sentencing.  All sentencing documents provided to counsel; any forms requiring def's signature to be filed upon obtaining same.
